info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 10:55AM CDT until March 26 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Vandalia. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flood Stage. Minor flooding begins. Unprotected farmland begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to 18.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning to 12.4 feet and begin rising again Monday evening. It will rise to 12.6 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Kaskaskia River Vandalia 18.0 15.7 Wed 10 am 18.3 17.4 15.0 12.9 12.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The NationalWeather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
